name: Scalable splitting algorithms for SKA
body:
### Introduction
Motivated by the planned construction of the Square Kilometre Array, which will become the largest sensor ever built by humankind and will acquire unprecedented amounts of data in radio astronomy, we developed two convex optimisation algorithms for solving the radio interferometric imaging problem. They are tailored for big-data and employ parallel and distributed computations to achieve scalability, in terms of memory and computational requirements.
The code made available here represents a proof of concept MATLAB implementation of the two proposed algorithms.

MNRAS [doi:10.1093/mnras/stw1859](http://dx.doi.org/10.1093/mnras/stw1859) first published online August 1, 2016_
